729364f-b.title: Richmond: Richmond Road - Clove Road
729364f-b.text:
(1)
788 Richmond Road, eaat side, between Clove
Road and Baltic Avenue, showing the house of Judge
Emerson, brother of Ralph Waldo Emerson.
February 15, 1929
P. L.Sperr
(2)
The same, another view.
March20, 1929
P. L. Sperr
(3)
The rear of the house, seen from Rhine Avenue.
March 20, 1929
P. L. Sperr

728816f-b.title: Richmond: Clove Road - Richmond Road
728816f-b.text:
Emerson Hill, Staten Island: Viewing south across
Clove Road (at Price Street) and showing new fashionable
residences rising on the hill.
View 1: April 22, 1932
View 2: June 5, 1931
P. L. Sperr

729363f.text:
t1)
786 hichmond Road, east side, between Clove Road
and Baltic evenue, showing the house of Judge nerson,

729383f-c.title: Richmond: Richmond Road - Clove Road
729383f-c.text:
(1)
Richmond Road, east side, between Clove Road and Prioe Street,
ahowing street car barns and offices (building in center) of the
trolley company. The view is northward from Clove Road.
July 6, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A view of old street cars beside the barns.
July 6, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
Another view of the old trolleys.
July 6, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

729384f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Road - Clove Road
729384f-a.text:
Richmond Road, at Clove Road: though not a native of
Staten ssland, Al Swith (former Governor Alfred Emanuel Smith),
has his admirers there, too.
June 23, 1937.
F.L. Sperr
